result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany Taylor Peters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters appeared by video.  Attorney William Hotchkiss in court for Brittany Taylor Peters.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing. Defense requests NGI evaluation. Court appoints Dr. Deborah Collins to conduct the examination.  Case adjourned for return on doctor's report in Branch 40.
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion to withdraw as counsel hearing.  Defense withdraws motion and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Brittany Taylor Peters not in court, in custody at Taycheedah Correctional Institution.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion to withdraw.  Court rescheduled the matter and ordered the State to file an order to produce.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Brittany Taylor Peters not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in Court for a plea and sentencing.  Defendant was not produced.  Defense requests a motion to withdraw date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney William Hotchkiss
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Email correspondence with parties to rescheduled plea and sentencing hearing. Plea and sentencing rescheduled for June 10th, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Attorney William Hotchkiss in court, defendant Brittany Taylor Peters not in court, in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Defense withdraws request for a bail bond hearing. Defense requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Court approves transfer of case to Branch 1 for a global resolution. Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in court with Attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with AJH (DOB 12/2/07)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in court with attorney William Hotchkiss.  Defendant Brittany Taylor Peters in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Brittany Taylor Peters appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
